appearances.title: KTVU FOX 2 News at 4pm : KTVU : January 6, 2026 4:00pm-5:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: darrell issa and san diego, ken calvert in riverside, those are where the five seats come forward forocrats. and that's what gets really important for democrats to kind of hold, if you will, vis a vis what happens in texas. these are all elements of of democrats moving to a majority, given how the districts are structured and the redistricting that goes on. the republicans have a slight advantage. but that advantage is is basically as i as i told you earlier, it's about the size of a texas football game attendees. they're about 2400, 2500 people that make a huge difference. and that's especially true in these districts in northern california that are kind of a clash of a suburban, rural nature that we see, like in the new congressional district one. so what happens in dc in november? ends, starts is the end all be all with here in california, in the northern part of the state, the middle part of the state and the southern part of the state. >> be fascinating to watch. >> david mcewen. always appreciate it. thank you so much, sir. >> thank you very much. nice to see you both. >> all ri

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives House Tributes to Late Rep. LaMalfa : CSPAN : January 10, 2026 2:54pm-3:59pm EST
appearances.snippet: ken calvert, from the great state of california. >> thank you, mr. speaker. the sudden passing of our close friend and colleague, doug lamalfa, has caused both shock and sadness throughout the entire house of representatives. we lost a friend and a colleague. his northern california constituents lost their tireless advocate in the house, and most tragically, his family lost a husband, a father and a grandfather. doug was a proud family man, and he and his wife, jill have four beautiful children. he just recently became a grandfather. doug was a fourth generation rice farmer, a contributor to our state's important role in producing the food that sustains america. his experience as a farmer provided the foundation for the future, as his future as a legislator, both in sacramento and here in washington, d.c. it comes as no surprise that in 2024, doug was unanimously elected to serve as the chairman of the congressional western caucus, one of the largest congressional membership groups on capitol hill, focusing on rural policy and issues that affect the west and
